title: beautiful, unique, quirky ampersands?
content: What are some of your favorites?
author: quiddity

comments.content:
I LOVE the Caslon italic ampersand.

Some more here in earlier threads:

[http://typophile.com/node/16742](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730162903/http:/typophile.com/node/16742 "http://typophile.com/node/16742")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/17015](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730162903/http:/typophile.com/node/17015 "http://typophile.com/node/17015")

It is usually worth doing a search first when you have a topic this specific as sometimes people won't bother responding to a topic that's already been covered extensively.

Sorry about that - I did go back and read the other threads.

Still looking for something a little more unusual...

[http://typophile.com/node/10868](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730162903/http:/typophile.com/node/10868 "http://typophile.com/node/10868")

[http://typophile.com/node/28831](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730162903/http:/typophile.com/node/28831 "http://typophile.com/node/28831")

Another two to look at.

Tim
Baskerville Italic also has a beautiful ampersand.
